title: (x) Mystery Q - ITC Airstream {James}
content: I had a request for ID of a sample a few minutes ago. Most of the lettering is a font I know as Dragonwick/Dragonwyck, but the Q is something else. I know I have seen it somewhere, and I will probably smack my forehead when I hear the answer, but can you folks help me out with it? ![Mystery Q](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525001655im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/39506.gif)
author: bowfinpw

comments.content:
No one has seen this Q before? I'm surprised! Please look again, in case you might have an idea.   
   
Thanks
I thing that's a "p" on drugs.
Maybe you were thinking of the Bergell "Q"? [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/bergell/](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525001655/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/bergell/)

That Q is from [ITC Airstream](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525001655/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/airstream/airstream/win-ttf/2044/character/0051/CP2/1/), which coincidently I first noticed on Milky Way Bars (obviously not the logotype) a few years ago. It does have that caramely look to it ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525001655im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)
I second that Yves! I knew I had seen it before. Good job James. Thanks!

No problem. Just to make you want one (they're delicious), here's the milky way wrapper with the caramely airstream. I have the writing on the side, too but I can't find that picture.   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525001655im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/40046.gif)
